name: GroupServiceApi
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
GroupServiceApi
description:
The Group API lets you inspect and manage your groups[https://cloud.google.comgoogle.monitoring.v3.Group].

A group is a named filter that is used to identify a collection of monitored resources. Groups are typically used to mirror the physical and/or logical topology of the environment. Because group membership is computed dynamically, monitored resources that are started in the future are automatically placed in matching groups. By using a group to name monitored resources in, for example, an alert policy, the target of that alert policy is updated automatically as monitored resources are added and removed from the infrastructure.

methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

params.name: service_path
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: channel
params.description: A Channel object through which to make calls.

params.name: chan_creds
params.description: A ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

params.name: app_name
params.description: The codename of the calling service.

params.name: app_version
params.description: The version of the calling service.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/group_service_api"

GroupServiceApi = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::GroupServiceApi

group_service_api = GroupServiceApi.new
formatted_name = GroupServiceApi.project_path("[PROJECT]")

# Iterate over all results.
group_service_api.list_groups(formatted_name).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
group_service_api.list_groups(formatted_name).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The project whose groups are to be listed. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number”+.

params.name: children_of_group
params.description:
A group name: +”projects/project_id_or_number/groups/group_id”+.
Returns groups whose +parentName+ field contains the group
name.  If no groups have this parent, the results are empty.

params.name: ancestors_of_group
params.description:
A group name: +”projects/project_id_or_number/groups/group_id”+.
Returns groups that are ancestors of the specified group.
The groups are returned in order, starting with the immediate parent and
ending with the most distant ancestor.  If the specified group has no
immediate parent, the results are empty.

params.name: descendants_of_group
params.description:
A group name: +”projects/project_id_or_number/groups/group_id”+.
Returns the descendants of the specified group.  This is a superset of
the results returned by the +childrenOfGroup+ filter, and includes
children-of-children, and so forth.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Monitoring::V3::Group instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/group_service_api"

GroupServiceApi = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::GroupServiceApi

group_service_api = GroupServiceApi.new
formatted_name = GroupServiceApi.group_path("[PROJECT]", "[GROUP]")
response = group_service_api.get_group(formatted_name)

params.name: name
params.description:
The group to retrieve. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number/groups/group_id”+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/group_service_api"

Group = Google::Monitoring::V3::Group
GroupServiceApi = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::GroupServiceApi

group_service_api = GroupServiceApi.new
formatted_name = GroupServiceApi.project_path("[PROJECT]")
group = Group.new
response = group_service_api.create_group(formatted_name, group)

params.name: name
params.description:
The project in which to create the group. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number”+.

params.name: group
params.description:
A group definition. It is an error to define the +name+ field because
the system assigns the name.

params.name: validate_only
params.description: If true, validate this request but do not create the group.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: update_group
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
GroupServiceApi#update_group
methods.description: Updates an existing group. You can change any group attributes except +name+.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/group_service_api"

Group = Google::Monitoring::V3::Group
GroupServiceApi = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::GroupServiceApi

group_service_api = GroupServiceApi.new
group = Group.new
response = group_service_api.update_group(group)

params.name: group
params.description:
The new definition of the group.  All fields of the existing group,
excepting +name+, are replaced with the corresponding fields of this group.

params.name: validate_only
params.description: If true, validate this request but do not update the existing group.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/group_service_api"

GroupServiceApi = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::GroupServiceApi

group_service_api = GroupServiceApi.new
formatted_name = GroupServiceApi.group_path("[PROJECT]", "[GROUP]")
group_service_api.delete_group(formatted_name)

params.name: name
params.description:
The group to delete. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number/groups/group_id”+.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: list_group_members
title: Google
Cloud
Monitoring
V3
GroupServiceApi#list_group_members
methods.description: Lists the monitored resources that are members of a group.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/monitoring/v3/group_service_api"

GroupServiceApi = Google::Cloud::Monitoring::V3::GroupServiceApi

group_service_api = GroupServiceApi.new
formatted_name = GroupServiceApi.group_path("[PROJECT]", "[GROUP]")

# Iterate over all results.
group_service_api.list_group_members(formatted_name).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
group_service_api.list_group_members(formatted_name).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: name
params.description:
The group whose members are listed. The format is
+”projects/project_id_or_number/groups/group_id”+.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: filter
params.description:
An optional list[https://cloud.google.com/monitoring/api/learn_more#filtering] describing the members to be returned. The filter may reference the type, labels, and metadata of monitored resources that comprise the group. For example, to return only resources representing Compute Engine VM instances, use this filter:

resource.type = "gce_instance"

params.name: interval
params.description:
An optional time interval for which results should be returned. Only
members that were part of the group during the specified interval are
included in the response.  If no interval is provided then the group
membership over the last minute is returned.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Api::MonitoredResource instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.
